unnormalised: **Traffic Woes Getting You Down? New Rules in Play, Yaar!**
normalised: **Traffic Woes Getting You Down? New Rules in Play, Yaar!**

unnormalised: Bangalore - Hold on to your rickshaws, folks! Traffic cops are cracking down harder than ever, especially with Onam just around the corner and everyone rushing around like headless chickens buying banana chips and payasam ingredients.
normalised: Bangalore - Hold on to your rickshaws, folks! Traffic cops are cracking down harder than ever, especially with Onam just around the corner and everyone rushing around like headless chickens buying banana chips and payasam ingredients.

unnormalised: New regulations are now in effect around MG Road and Brigade Road. Turns are being restricted during peak hours (8 AM - 11 AM and 5 PM - 8 PM), so plan your biryani runs carefully! Cops are using those fancy new AI cameras to catch violators - no more sneaky U-turns for you, Raju!
normalised: New regulations are now in effect around M G Road and Brigade Road. Turns are being restricted during peak hours (eight A M - eleven A M and five P M - eight P M), so plan your biryani runs carefully! Cops are using those fancy new A I cameras to catch violators - no more sneaky U-turns for you, Raju!

unnormalised: Expect heavier fines, starting at Rs. 500 for minor offenses. They are also enforcing the helmet rule strictly, especially for pillion riders. Don't be a hero, wear a helmet.
normalised: Expect heavier fines, starting at rupee five hundred for minor offenses. They are also enforcing the helmet rule strictly, especially for pillion riders. Don't be a hero, wear a helmet.

unnormalised: The city corporation also announced the implementation of new 'Smart Parking' zones in Koramangala. These use sensors to detect available spaces, which could seriously reduce the time spent circling blocks looking for parking. Initial estimates suggest this could cut down on up to 15% of the unnecessary driving happening in the city.
normalised: The city corporation also announced the implementation of new 'Smart Parking' zones in Koramangala. These use sensors to detect available spaces, which could seriously reduce the time spent circling blocks looking for parking. Initial estimates suggest this could cut down on up to fifteen percent of the unnecessary driving happening in the city.

unnormalised: Remember folks, safety first, then biryani! Happy driving!
normalised: Remember folks, safety first, then biryani! Happy driving!
